moves.4. Qf3 a5 5. Bc4: Luckily, I see this one coming
moves.5... Qd7 6. Bxf7+ Qxf7 7. Qc3: I don't understand why he doesn't take the queen when he has just lost his bishop
moves.7... Bb7: Putting pressure on the e pawn
moves.8. Qe3 Nc6: A stupid move by me, blocking the bishop from the pawn
moves.11. Qe2 Nf6: More pressure on the e pawn
moves.12. Ng1 Ne7: The bishop is back in attack
moves.13. Nf3 Bxe4: Ha ha! The advantage is on my side
moves.14. Ng1 Bxb1: I end my bishop's life by eliminating the knight
moves.15. Rxb1: Little does he realise he is being set-up
moves.16... e4: Although the queen cannot take the pawn, it can still protect the knight
moves.17. Qc2 d5 18. Ne2 c5 19. f3 d4: The battle of the pawns begins!
moves.22. Qxd3: Now I am beginning to lose confidence
moves.23... Nd7 24. Nc3 Qe6: I officially give up the battle with the rook
moves.25. b4 Ra8 26. Bb2 O-O: It is time to castle and get both of my rooks into the game
moves.27. Qd3 Ne5: The queen keeps getting in danger
moves.30... Nxe6 31. Nd5 Rf4: No! Now my rook will be....
moves.35... Kf7 36. Bd6 Rxa3: Getting the rook behind the defences
moves.38. Kc2 Rxb4: I take the other rook, immediately realising my mistake
moves.39. Bxb4: ??? Rxa1 and we both have one rook
moves.39... Rxh1 40. d4 Rc1+: My first good move in a long time
moves.41. Kd3 Bf8: Pressure, pressure, pressure. Where would we be without it?
moves.42. Nc6: A smart move, but it has a flaw.
moves.42... Rxc6 43. Bxf8 Kxf8 44. d5: Is this the end of the rook?
moves.44... Rd6: No, but white resigned here. Does anyone know why?
